revised_title: Electrical Changes in Nerve and Their Relation to Physico-Chemical Changes
tldr: The author conducted experiments on excised frog nerves to study the relationship between electrical changes and physico-chemical changes in nerve cells. They discovered that the magnitude of electrical changes in nerve cells can be used as an index to measure the magnitude of chemico-physical changes under various chemical conditions. The author also investigated the effects of various substances, such as anaesthetics, acids, alkalies, neutral salts, and narcotics on the electrical activity of nerve cells.
